raw_response:
When served, **Adafina appears as a rich, thick stew**, typically presented in a bowl rather than on a plate. It has a hearty, somewhat stew-like consistency—thicker and less soupy—due to the long slow-cooking process that softens and blends the ingredients into a cohesive savory dish. The broth is clear or lightly colored, silky from the rendered fat and caramelized sugars, and the overall texture is tender but not mushy[1][6].
